> [{quoted}](name=BigBadBadger,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ba3ELd3w,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-03-08T20:23:53.337+0000)
>
> Do I sense free spellvamp?

Any spells, except spells that specifically **only** trigger on-hit effects (or are **only** on-hit effects on their own), proc spell effects. It doesn't mean you can get *FREE* spell vamp. It only means you can buy any items that come with spell effects. His passive is essentially an AOE spell, which cuts spell vamp into 1/3.
Free as in: it won't use up mana or cooldowns.

Okay so a passive that requires him to actually stand at a fixed short (almost melee) distance from the enemy(-ies) to benefit from spell vamp (Note that enemies standing inside his orbit or outside his orbit are not affected by his passive) without using mana or cooldown pretty doesn't benefit much from spell vamp as much as you think, aside from the fact that this spell only benefits Aurelion Sol for 1/3 of spell vamp.
and his w......
Then it is not exactly free because toggling W on costs mana.
Yeah but leaving it at small mode is free of any mana charge
He can still heal off minions.

Any champions with the ability to trigger spell effects can. The question is: whether it is worth it or not. For Aurelion Sol, all of his damaging abilities are AOE, rendering spell vamp much less useful.

You are better off getting Rylai's Crystal Scepter and probably Liandry's Torment if you want to make use of his passive. Liandry may not be even worth it.
3 minions and you've made up for the 1/3 effectiveness of spellvamp. His Q can take a whole wave plus the Champion.

You seem to think he's saying its OP. He might be but he could just be saying that spellvamp will be strong on him like life steal is strong on auto attackers, because he can naturally proc it without having to wait on cool downs or resources, similar to autos.

manamune is not a spellproc, it procs on physical only, and also only on singletarget, so nope, it certainly won't proc on his passive, as it's magical aoe.

Physical only is wrong. Any single target spell or attack will proc Muramana. 

For example, Ahri's W applies it three times; each foxfire is considered single target.

I don't think it's the same case with Aurelion Sol.

Aurelion Sol's passive is essentially a permanent Diana's W without shield. Diana's W is an AOE spell.

Ahri's W is single-target spell only because the orbs auto-aims itself at target(s) one at a time with priorities. I don't think it works the same as Aurelion Sol's passive.
You are correct; I was just pointing out that there are spells that are non-physical that proc Muramana.
